sourcing.instructions: Co: Obtain from a chemical supplier or metal alloy distributor. Li: Purchase from a specialized chemical supplier. P: Source from a chemical supplier or laboratory supply store. Zr: Obtain from a metal supplier or chemical distributor.
steps: Co: Obtain from a chemical supplier or metal alloy distributor. Li: Purchase from a specialized chemical supplier. P: Source from a chemical supplier or laboratory supply store. Zr: Obtain from a metal supplier or chemical distributor.

1. Measure the required amounts of Co, Li, P, and Zr using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Li, P, and Zr thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Ensure uniform distribution of the powders. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill and mill for 2 hours at a speed of 200 RPM to achieve a homogeneous powder.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure the required amounts of Co, Li, P, and Zr using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine Co, Li, P, and Zr thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Ensure uniform distribution of the powders. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a ball mill and mill for 2 hours at a speed of 200 RPM to achieve a homogeneous powder.

steps: 1. Preheat a sintering furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the homogenized powder into a graphite mold suitable for the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Insert the mold into the preheated furnace and maintain for 4 hours to allow for sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a sintering furnace to 1200째C. 2. Place the homogenized powder into a graphite mold suitable for the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Insert the mold into the preheated furnace and maintain for 4 hours to allow for sintering.

steps: 1. After the sintering duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 25째C) over a period of 6-8 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door during cooling to prevent thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the graphite mold carefully. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges or surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant or protective coating to enhance durability and surface finish. Allow to cure for the recommended time as per the product instructions (generally 24 hours).
